title: The Delivery
description:
Pam goes into labor and Jim is ready to take her to the hospital, but she refuses to go. Meanwhile, inspired by Pam and Jim's baby, Dwight and Angela try to reach a "business agreement" to have a baby of their own.
After the baby is born, Pam has trouble getting the baby to breastfeed. At the office, Michael takes credit for hooking Jim and Pam up, and tries to do the same thing for Kevin and Erin, making Andy jealous.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone with a client] I just wanted to check and see if there's anything you needed before I went on my maternity leave...  Yeah, I'm pregnant...  Great, well, I'll write up the order.  Okay, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait a minute!  You can't do that.  You cannot exploit your baby for sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey, did I tell you we were going to have a baby?  Oh, thank you very much.  I'm excited.  Oh, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no!  You need to come by your sales honorably!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There is nothing dishonorable about talking about your life.  People like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone with a client]  Hey there.  Dwight Schrute here.  Listen, uh, would you be interested in restocking on paper? ...  Yeah, I could sure use the money.  My cousin, uh, came down with a case of that nasty new goat fungus.  Oh, it's just horrific.  The  doctor says he'd never seen it beard so quickly.  Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need a baby.  I'll never outsell Jim and Pam without one.  Also, I've been noticing a gaping hole in my life.  Sometimes I wake up cradling a gourd.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin, you're such a gourmand.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I cooked my way through Julia Childs' cookbook, and now, I'm halfway through the Twilight cookbook.  Last night, I had Edward's corn flake chicken.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pregnant Pam and I, we get hungry at the same times, so we've been eating together a lot.  Not all meals.  Just second breakfast, lunch, second lunch, and first dinner.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I thought that maybe we should do something special for early dinner.  One last ultra feast.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmmm, that sounds great.  What are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think it should be a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [After Pam has a contraction]  Oh, getting there, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no.  I still have time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm having contractions, but they're irregular and far apart.  So I'm not really in labor, I'm near labor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, we're slow-playing it because of our stupid HMO.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If we check in after midnight, I get an extra day to recuperate surrounded by doctors.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not to mention the extra night's sleep in the hospital will be very nice because once we bring the baby home, if it's crying all night, one of us is going to have to take care of it.  And I do not plan on helping unless it's a boy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I cannot wait for that joke to be over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh, oh!  Contraption!  She's contrapting!  Okay, you know what?  I think I should drive you guys to the hospital, and here is why.  I am a licensed, classy driver in the state of Pennsylvania.  I gassed up the car...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Actually, I put diesel in this time, trying to save some money.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, you shouldn't have done that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Happy to do it.  Also, I did a heck of a job baby-proofing this office.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know the baby's not going to live here, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, the baby was conceived here, so might as well live here a little bit, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm, that logic's air-tight, but unfortunately it wasn't conceived here.  Burning man, port-o-potty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yuck!  TMI!  How was it?  I don't want to know.  Tell me later.  Let's go!  Let's go!  Hospital!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, okay, we're not going to the hospital.  We are waiting until midnight.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ooh, spooky.  But why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because the insurance company only covers two nights.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Everything's fine.  We have plenty of time.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Well, you don't want to wait too long, Pam.  Otherwise the baby's going to become a teenager in there and you'll be up all night, from the rock music.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up, Nick.  What a weird thing to say.  Weird I.T. nerd.  Don't get revenge on me, nerd.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [as Nick looks over at her]  What are you looking at?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha, nerd.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Did you know that labor can last weeks?  Then they take your insides out and they just plop them on a table, and sometimes epidurals don't work, and you can poop yourself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [with Angela in the break room]  Bare my child.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want to have a child for business reasons and I want you to be the mother.  If you agree, say nothing.  If you disagree, say anything...  Very well.  Let's meet at 4:00 PM at our old meeting spot and bang it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after Pam has another contraction]  That's seven minutes.  Here we go.  This is happening.  Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hold on, hold on.  It isn't midnight yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you serious?  Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, the doctor said every five to seven minutes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I...  Pam, please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm going to be okay, we should really try to make it until midnight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, no, you really should.  Because if your baby's born tomorrow, he's going to have the same birthday as Butt-mud Brooks.  My old roommate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you hear that?  Butt-mud Brooks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, but we are leaving at five minutes apart.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Five minutes apart.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, the plan was seven minutes.  But we're calling an audible, because that's her call.  Because she's the quarterback.  I'm just the left tackle who happened to get her pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, stop watching me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, crazy.  I think I have some better things to do with my day than worry about you, like sell printers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well not until Friday 20% off toner cartridges, that's a big deal.  While we're on the subject, why don't I just run you down to the hospital and we'll just do a quick check?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not until midnight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys.  Word of advice.  Speaking as a former baby.  Don't get too hung up on baby names.  I was named Walter Jr. after my father until I was about six or so, when my parents changed their minds.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I thought you said your younger brother was named Walter Jr.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My brother was born, and my parents felt he better exemplified the Walter Jr. name, so they gave it to him.  I was given Andrew, which they got out of a baby name book.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, it's getting real crowded in here.  Maybe you guys should all go back to work because the day's not out yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no.  You know what?  You can't tell us what to do because you are not co-manager anymore.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as Andy and Kevin shout "yeah!" in response to Michael] Okay, I feel like this noise is going to prevent Pam from being able to listen to her body's signals.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Actually, the distractions are good.  I mean, I don't think I'm going to make it until midnight if I'm just sitting here thinking about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Distractions are good!  That means conference room, five minutes!  No, no, five seconds!  Right now, right now!  Conference room!  Topic, potpourri!  Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, I am sort of a master of distraction.  When I was a kid, my mom received compliments left and right from my teachers on how I was always able to distract others in class.  Try to think, what were the first thirteen colonies?  Mm-hmm, mm-hmm.  [Michael covers his mouth and makes fart noises.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The purpose for this meeting is to take Pam's mind off of what's going on inside of her body.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can we do sleight of hand tricks?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will allow that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!  Can anyone do those?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm going to go look at the Internet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as Pam has another contraction]  Oh!  Oh, alright.  That's a good one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay, uh, sorry, guys.  Just, um, keep talking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, Pam, you are a woman warrior.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Does anybody have anything?  Anything interesting, any hobbies, uh, special skills?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, this is the only time I'm ever going to make this request.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Phyl?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I can put on lipstick the way Molly Ringwald does in The Breakfast Club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [ as Pam shakes her head] Nope, nope, I don't think anybody wants to see that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can do the evolution of dance-dance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Pam gives the thumbs up]  That sounds good!  Do you need some music, or...?  Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope, actually music would just throw me off.  I need complete silence.  Okay...  [Pam begins to clap as Andy dances]  You're clapping.  I need complete silence.  Totally threw me off, so I'm going to have to start over.  Evolution of dance-dance.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [reading from a book as Kelly admires]  "You let me in your bed.  But now, I sleep alone.  Trapped with the forgotten in my detritus home."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [naming race horses]  Affirmed.  Seattle Slew.  Secretariat.  Citation.  Assault.  Count Fleet.  Whirlaway.  War Admiral.  Omaha.  Gallant Fox...  And...  I know this.  Uh...  The jockey was Johnny Loftus.  Sired by Star Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Before we conceive a child, uh, it is important that we bang out a parenting contract.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's been a long time since we've come down here separately.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You know I was thinking...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now, then.  Let's get to it, shall we?  Item one:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Pam has another contraction]  Where are we?  We have every six minutes, ladies and gentlemen.  Another seventy five contractions and you are going to be there.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For the love of God, Pam, do it for ultra feast!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what?  I'm going to go give, uh, doctor Asmani a quick call.  He'd probably know...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, please.  Happy thoughts here.  Happy times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, happy times.  Come on.  Let's have happy times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, as a matter of fact, I have printed out ten ways to induce labor.  And I'm thinking we just do the opposite of those things and we can slow down your labor.  Erin, read the first one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Um, stimulate the nipples.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, nobody touch Pam's nipples.  Think of Pam's nipples as Toby's grundle.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Her shirt is touching them.  Maybe we should cut holes in her shirt.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I have a shirt like that in my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yeah, why don't you go get it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, uh, the second one is walk around.  We're already doing the opposite of that.  Perfect.  Okay, number three, eat spicy foods.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, the opposite of that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Stick spicy food up her butt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, nope, nope, nope.  Come on, let's go to the hospital.  Pam, let's go to the hospital right now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, Jim, honey, I love you, but you're really distracting me from my distractions.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.  Okay, great.  Well, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why don't you go do some work?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.  I will do that.  Sorry, Pam, I just feel a little bit frazzled.  And you know how very rarely I use that word.  Frazzled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know, you don't like to be frazzled.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, and by the way, hate that you're helping her with this right now.  Totally.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ooh, someone's freakin'.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A little frazzled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think he is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know Pam better than anyone in this office, and obviously she's gone crazy, but everybody wants to say that I'm crazy.  But I'm not crazy, she's crazy.  I'm not crazy, she's crazy.  [reading from various books]  Five to seven minutes.  Five to seven minutes.  Six minutes.  Different, but not really.  Five to seven minutes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Acceptable names include and are limited to:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam approaches as he sits in his car]  Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.  I'm not going to get in the car, because I know if I do you'll try to drive me to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, you know me too well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?  ...  Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Everything is fine.  You don't have to worry.  Try not to think about it.  She's not coming out for a while, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did you say "she?"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I called the doctor like a week ago.  I couldn't wait...  Oh, God, don't be mad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mad?  How could I be mad?  We're having a little girl.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, we're having a little girl.  Oh, man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Woo, alright.  Well, I definitely feel better.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright...  Hey, did you change?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, my water broke.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.  Oh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [enters the office and has another contraction]  Oh, whoa.  Ha.  Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, Pam!  Okay, alright, okay, it's time.  Time to go to the hospital.  Somebody get Jim, please!  Is it midnight yet?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, it's 4:35.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 4:35.  Alright, almost made it.  Almost made it.  Too bad you didn't have sex like seven and a half hours later.  But you had to have the afternoon delight.  I understand.  Sometimes you have to go for it.  Let's go to the hospital, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, not yet, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We can do...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wow, it's almost time for ultra feast!  Where's Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  What?  You want to eat cat food with Kevin and not go to the hospital?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's fancy feast.  Ultra feast is something they made up so they can pig out together in the name of ceremony.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is October feast?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There is no rush to get to the hospital.  I am fine.  I'll get there.  And if I don't get there, I don't get there.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Our ultra feast menu's theme:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got it!  I got it!  Everybody it's go time!  At your stations.  Stanley, man the phones.  Meredith, please, get bottled water.  Erin, call an ambulance, please!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no.  Ambulances are emergencies only.  You call an ambulance, I call the cops.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, we're driving ourselves, actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Jim, you are in no condition to drive.  I will drive you.  Check!  Got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, I have my wallet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go bag's in the car...  Keys, my keys, where's my keys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go bag! Where's my go bag?  Where's my go bag?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There's nothing in it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are telling me now that there is nothing in it.  Okay, great!  Oh, hey, hey, um, should I bring a dictionary to the hospital?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The hospital provides dictionaries, bring a thesaurus!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Has anyone checked how dilated she is?  This is ridiculous!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, get away!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no.  Dwight, let Jim do that, please.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I didn't know we had a tape measure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as he holds up the tape measure with his initials on it] "We" don't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I can't find my keys!  I cannot find my keys!  Found 'em.  They're here.

quotes.speaker: {dwight}, {jim} and {michael}
quotes.text: Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Good luck!

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Good luck, Pam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you!  Wish me luck!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Have fun!  [sigh]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, it's 5:00!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [entering the elevator] Here we go!  Here we go!  On our way!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hold it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, Stanley!  Okay.  We're going now!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, one more!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no!  Out, out!  Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, what is the traffic like?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Doesn't matter.  I'll escort you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Geesh, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as he peels out of the parking lot and stops] Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is where I saw that deer last week.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right over by that fence.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: By the bushes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Michael!  Focus!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, go, go, go, go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I love escorting people.  In fact, a few years back, I put an ad in the paper starting an escort service.  I got a lot of responses.  Mostly creeps.  Made a few friends.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, here we go!  You're doing great!  She'll be here soon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, just breathe...  She?  You found out?  Come on, guys.  I wanted to be surprised.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop texting, put your phone away!  Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm texting about you, okay!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ugh, alright.  [as he puts a police siren on top of his car]  Let's move!  ...  What?

quotes.speaker: Policeman
quotes.text: Pull over!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Policeman
quotes.text: Pull over!  [Dwight begins throwing various weapons out of the window]  You're not allowed to impersonate a police officer!  Don't make this difficult, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, wait.  My iPod's not in here!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It has the birth song on it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.  I know, I know.  But my iPod is in the go bag.  We'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, I don't want the first thing the baby hears to be the 8 Mile soundtrack.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so what do you want to do?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know!  Let's go by the house and get it.  It's only twenty minutes past the hospital!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, no!  Are you nuts?  We're going to the hospital now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, guys!  Stop fighting, come on.  Come on.  Do you want your kid to come out a lawyer?  Right?  Okay, you know what?  I am all over this.  Here we go.  [as he calls Dwight]  Ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Dwight.  Pam left her iPod at her house.  I want you to swing by, pick it up, and bring it to the hospital.  We need it yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why didn't you ask me to do it yesterday?  I kept IM'ing you how bored I was.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight!  Go to my house.  Get my iPod.  I think it's on the kitchen table.  Do not touch anything else.  The key is under...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't need a key.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, Dwight, but if you do need a key, just listen it's under the...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, don't, don't tell me.  Alalalalalalalalalala lalalalalala alalalalalalalala.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight just listen!  It's underneath...  [Dwight hangs up as the policeman hands him a ticket]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, you alright?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you have everything, guys?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, just go park the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, alright.  [he parks in an ambulance zone]

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Sir!  You can't park here!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin.  It's okay.  [he throws the keys into bushes across the street]  I just did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam's doing great.  Uh, she's ten inches dilated now.  Uh, sorry, meters.  Centimeters.  And she's also fully faced.  Which I don't know what that is, uh, but no baby yet.  It's only been six, uh, nineteen hours, and uh, I just went out for some ice chips because I might have passed out a little bit, but these are very refreshing, very good.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Daddy?  She's ready to push.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where is my little nibblet?  Halpert, room D1.  Alright, family only beyond this point, thank you.  Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as Pam screams]  Doing great, push again.

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: Not yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, don't push.  Pull.  Pull.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Why don't you get more ice chips?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Jim, stay!

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: Okay.  Really push this time, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking horrified as he walks from the room back into the lobby]  Okay, not yet, not yet.  I'm going to go wash my eyes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That kid's going to have a lot of hair.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, have you guys seen her?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: She hasn't popped yet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?  God damn it.  She was supposed to come out yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I decided to give baby Halpert a newspaper from the day she was born.  This frame set me back fifty five bones.  But she decided to take her sweet time, so now I have to switch it with today's paper.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This is ridiculous.  We just can't wait here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think it's going to be any minute now.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But you don't know that.  I mean, we could be here another half an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis, what could you possibly have to do?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have an ice cream cake in the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God.  Go, go, go!  Are you insane?  Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam screams as he approaches the door to their room]  Guys?  Hello?  Um, sorry to be a bother, but if we could have an ETA when this is gonna...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is happening!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're starting, you're kinda losing them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God!  Look at her!  baby, she's so beautiful!  Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [smoking a cigar]  Yeah, that's right.  It's a baby, see?

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.text: Sir!  Sir, you can't smoke that in here.  Put it, put it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  You can't smoke anywhere these days.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [with Jim, holding the baby]  She's incredible.  Want to count her fingers and toes again?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, let's let her rest.  I'm sure there's still twelve on each.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, guys!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Her name is Cecelia Marie Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eleven pounds...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She's seven pounds, two ounces, eighteen inches.  Mother and daughter are doing great.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you!  Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Congratulations.  That's great.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Hi there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, grandma's back.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Well, it was an adventure and a half trying to find the cafeteria, but I have returned with the coffee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thank God.  I haven't had caffeine in nine months.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Ooh, somebody has a full diaper.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.  Let me get it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am a diapering master.  I have done little else in the past two months.  There is nothing I cannot diaper.  Go ahead.  Try to think of something.  I dare you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where's the baby?  I want to see the baby.  Oh!  Oh, Helene, hi.  Oh, my goodness, what are the odds of this?  Congratulations on being a grandma.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Hello, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.  Oh, good for you.  I worry about you.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: I'm, uh...  You know I think, uh, I think it's time for me to go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Helene
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Love you, as a friend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you, mom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ooh, I want to hold the baby!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, you just have to use the hand sanitizer first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Again, no pants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.  Oh.  Ooh, wow.  Michael.  Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's so weird, she was saying it just before you got here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yesterday, I was dispatched to Jim and Pam's house to find Pam's iPod.  I searched everywhere, but I didn't find it.  What I did find, was mold, and lots of it.  So, I did what anyone would do.  Read a book, had a bath, I got a good night's sleep, and I made plans to eradicate it.  I also made plans to ask Jim where he bought his marvelous sheets...  Time to get to work [he begins to destroy the kitchen with a sledgehammer].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There she sat.  Her name was Pam.  She was a receptionist.  She was engaged to an animal.  There sat Jim.  He was a gawky, tall salesman.  The odds of them getting together were insur-mountain-able.  I made a family!  I got these two together, and I made a family.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This man has a gift!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who else here is single?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm not single.  I have a man. [she grasps Ryan's arm as Ryan has his hand raised to say he's single]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am offering up my services to you all.  You saw what I did with Pam and Jim.  I can help you, too.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why do you find someone for yourself instead of meddling in our affairs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, show of hands.  Who wants to live in a world where Stanley has two lovers and you don't have any?  [Stanley raises his hand]  Who else?  Come on!  People, I know models!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ha ha, plus size models, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha ha, you got that right!  Meredith?  Come on, you're obviously single.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You know it.  I am never getting married.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Like Clooney.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andrew, what about you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Torn scrotum.  Still on the mend, so not good timing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, I'm going to ask out Erin.  I'm just waiting for the stars to align.  Literally.  I have a small skylight in my bedroom, and I'd like for the moon to be visible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, when you least expect it, expect it.  I am going to fill the empty voids in your life with love.  I am going to fill that empty hole in your body with another person.  And, like Cupid, I am going to shoot you with love.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Remember yesterday when we were terrified of being parents?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We were just kids.  What did we know?

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: How we doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Would you like me to take her to the nursery for the night?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Doesn't she sleep here?

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: She can.  But a lot of parents choose to have the baby spend the first night in the nursery to get some rest.  You've been through a lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think we'll be okay.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Okay, great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [as the baby yawns]  Oh, big yawn.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ready?  One, two, three...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One, and then wrap around.  It's okay.  Hold that arm down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't.  She's too strong.  She's, careful, though.  You don't want to break it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's not gonna...  Just...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I got it.  Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nurse!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know.  I just, I can't tell if she's getting anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Doesn't feel right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you're pushing the milk out, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How does one do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wasn't it...  It's kinda like a...  Like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want to try it, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you're good.  Doing a good job.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Somebody buzzed?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh!  Really?  Must have sat on it, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't tell if she's getting anything.  It just doesn't really feel right.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Well, maybe we should take a break for a little while.  I can take her to the nursery and then bring her back and try again a little bit later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Even if she's not getting anything?

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Yeah, she'll be fine.  I can always give her a bottle since we're in the nursery.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  I read in the book about nipple confusion.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Oh, good.  You know everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's just, she's really tentative about latching, and I just, I want to keep her self-esteem up.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Well, I'll bring her back in a little while and we can try again, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's going to be alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe it'll be good because then she can like socialize with the other babies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ha ha.  No, yeah, that will be good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [in Michael's office]  You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What would you say, if I told you that I was about to change your life?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, boy!  ...  What's that sound?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [as he appears from behind the door]  Ta-da!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like you to meet your new boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know what to say.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, say nothing.  You will learn to love me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, hold on.  Whoa, whoa, whoa.  You got to let the cookies cool before you pop 'em in your mouth.  Why don't you guys get to know each other?  Maybe have lunch together?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Erin, would you have lunch with me?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael, could I talk to you privately?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.  Kevin, please leave.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm so sorry if I gave you the impression I'm into Kevin, but I'm not.  I like Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  This is going to kill Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm sure he'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not so sure.  Kevin has an enormous heart.  Literally, he has an elephant heart.  He had a transplant when he was seventeen.  Had some problems, blah blah blah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Kevin doesn't have an elephant heart.  But he is very sensitive.  And it won't kill Erin just to go and have lunch with him in the break room like I promised him...  I bet his heart is enlarged, though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't want anyone to die.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just don't let him sit on you...  I'm kidding.  You'll have fun.  It'll be good.  It'll be good.  There he is.  Go to him.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: She touched my shoulder.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Hey, guys.  We're short on rooms, so this is Dale and Kathy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hi.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Dale
quotes.text: Hi, so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Careful...  Wow, she just shoves the nipple right in there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You see that?  I'm pretty sure she's...  Hi.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight and friends continue to destroy the Halperts' kitchen with hammers]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Did you grow up around here?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So, you must have grown up around somewhere else?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why was I hiding behind the plant?  Ha, well, in college, I took a botony class, and there was lots of drama in that class.  Uh, kids would gossip about me, so I would eavesdrop on them by hiding behind different plants in the botony class.  And then, uh, they would say things like "Oh, this guy's going to fail this class," or, "What's this guy doing spying on us from behind plants?"  And then I would jump out of them and confront them, and be like, "Oh, you think all I do is hide behind plants and spy on people?  Busted." ...  Oh, the reason?  The reason I was hiding behind that plant in this situation was that I thought that Erin and Kevin were kind of hitting it off, and...  I was jealous.

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Uh, hi, Pam Halpert?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Hi.  I'm Clark.  Josie said you might benefit from a lactation consultant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, yeah, that would be great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.  Really great.  When's she available?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Actually, uh, I'm the consultant.  Got milk?  Ha ha.  Alright, let's see what we're working with.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, uh, biggest thing, besides not being able to get her to latch...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I'll get that for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.  Is that um, I can't tell if I'm really producing.  I don't know if she's getting anything.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Okay.  Let me feel here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah, it's quite full.  Why don't you put your hand on top of my hand.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: When you're feeding, you want to press in like this, make your hand in a C.  Uh, does that hurt?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean, it feels...  pressure.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you sure it doesn't hurt?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.  It just feels like pressure.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Okay, well.  Feel how I'm flicking the nipple?  Like that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Stimulate it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Alright, so you just want to do that, and that will, uh...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: And you can just...  The baby should grab on to that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she will.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.  So, I'm just not sure if I'm releasing, though.  I'm not sure if...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: It doesn't...  Why don't you bring your baby over here...  She's beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.  Aw, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yes, congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, you're doing a good job.  Just stay relaxed, and I'll come back in a bit to check on you.  Okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Please do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, shoot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shoot, she fell off.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, uh, try the torpedo thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Will you just, will you grab Clark real quick?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No need.  I saw him do it.  I can try it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Jim, please, please, please, I think it'd be weird if you did it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'll just go get the other guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on the phone]  Hey, what's up, kid?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Have you had a chance to look over the revisions on the contract I've prepared for you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing left to do except dot the I's, the J's, and the umlauts.  Why don't you meet me here at exactly mid-late afternoon?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I look forward to it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [trying to sleep as the baby cries]  Jim, Jim, get her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Get the baby.  Get her.  Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.  Sshh.  I know.  [hands the baby to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got her.  Okay.  Okay.  Okay...  Jim!  She latched!  She latched.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's amazing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God.  I didn't even have to do the "C thing."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aw, we're doing it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: that's great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're really parents now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin.  Erin would like a few words with you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I have really enjoyed our time together.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I want to continue working on our friendship.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Really, really fun.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Because I think our friendship could be a really cool thing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And, you're my friend.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And I hope that I'm your friend...  And, maybe...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God, this is agonizing.  Look, Kevin, do you really think that you could have dated Erin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You said she liked me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, even if someone told you that, you should know that that could never be possible, Kevin.  And I'm surprised that you didn't question me in the first place.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I've dumped better than Erin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Lynn was way hotter than Erin, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lynn was as hot as Erin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, Michael, but you dated Holly and Jan, and they were so much hotter than you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This isn't about me, and that is debatable.  And I have a personality, where as you...  Yes, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [he hits his head on the desk after ducking out of the way from hiding behind a plant]  Ow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kev...  Nice.  Going.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Knock knock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Isabelle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Hey.  Pam, she's gorgeous.  Can I hold her?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.  She was a little fussy earlier, but she's totally quieted down.  Here, let me just, uh, let me just burp her.  I don't want her to spit up on you.  Come here, sweety...  Oh, my God!  Wrong baby!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wrong baby!  This is not our baby!  Sshh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: [waking up]  Oh,has she been fussing long?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, not at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: I was out like a light...  Oh, she's not hungry...

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I feel like she needs to eat, but she won't latch on, which is weird, because the other baby di...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ha ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Bottles are fine.  A lot of babies grow up using bottles.  So are you excited to bring your baby home?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We definitely are.  At 3:00, right?  You said we could stay until 3:00?

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Yeah, you can.  It's 2:35.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Half hour.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Twenty five minutes.  And you're all set with the car seat?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, car seat's right there.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: That bottom part needs to go in the car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Newsflash, the whole thing needs to go in the car.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: Ha ha, be back in twenty five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Or it could be a half hour, if you need it to be...  Can we get a late checkout?  I don't...  I don't think she heard me.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: [entering the Halpert house]  Hello?  Dwight?  What, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Isabelle.  Hello...  Yeah, the uh, kitchen was disgusting, so...

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Wow, ha.  New cabinets.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: All I did was bring macaroni and cheese...  Where's the fridge?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, it's...  In the backyard.  I'll take this.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Oh...  Well, I'll let you get back to it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, listen.  I know that I'm an adult, but maybe I could come by sometime for a teeth cleaning.  You know, just for fun.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Well, adults are supposed to go to the dentist, too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are they now?  Ha ha, how some people spend their money, right?  Ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright.  I'll call you, kid.

quotes.speaker: Isabelle
quotes.text: Do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you really sure we should be leaving?

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But you hear the baby crying, right?

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Mm-hmm...  Where's your car?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, it's in the lot.

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Oh, a lot of fathers bring their car around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right, okay.  Yes, that would be the smart thing to do.  Uh, Pam, I will be right back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, please hurry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, uh, I need you to send this fax immediately.  It's really important, so I'm going to stand here and wait for the confirmation.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The fax says "Erin, will you have dinner with me?" from Andy, and the number is our office fax number.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's busy.  Why don't I keep trying, and then I'll give you the confirmation in a bit?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sorry, that's unacceptable.  I need you to send it immediately, or you're fired.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [tearing up]  You can't talk to me like that.  I didn't do anything wrong.  I've been having a tough day today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, God, no.  I'm...  Just read the fax.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You read the fax.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm...  I'm asking you out.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, my God.  That's amazing.  Let me just fax this, and I'll check my planner.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, it's a date.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.  Do you have a day in mind?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, what day?  What day?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Everyday is fine.  Or...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, that, what's that one?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thursday?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.  Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Would you like me to help you up out of the chair?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Hospital Employee
quotes.text: Yeah, we just got a lot of discharges today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, alright, thanks...  Okay, do you want to eat?  You want to try eating?  Okay...  Okay, let me...  Just you and me.  Come on.  There we go...  Yeah...  Oh, yeah.  Like that.  There we go.  You got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Five tickets on the windshield...  Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.  We did it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You used my move, didn't you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I used a variation of your move.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [smoking a cigar]  There is no greater feeling than when two people who are perfect for each other overcome all obstacles, and find true love.  And that is what I thought that Erin and Kevin were going to find today...  I think I'm going to be sick...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two forms of ID, please.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And now you, two forms of ID, please...  Alright, all is in order.  I just need your signature...  What is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Alright.  How would you like to celebrate?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just pour yourself a cup of apple juice.  I feel sick...  [Jim and Pam walk in to their house with the baby]  I couldn't find the iPod...  Give me a couple days.  I'll be out of your hair.
